generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: Benjamin Posey, a pediatric patient, sustained a right index finger fracture, which was initially managed with a cast. He reports that immediately after cast removal, there was a slight reduction in range of motion, with increased stiffness noted approximately 10 minutes later. He has experienced improvement in mobility and pain over time, with no current tenderness on palpation. The patient is eager to resume normal activities, including school and physical play, but is concerned about re-injury. He is currently in good spirits and cooperative during the visit. The family reports that he is tired of wearing the cast and is motivated to return to regular activities. The fracture is located in the proximal phalanx near the growth plate, and imaging demonstrates early signs of remodeling and stable healing. The patient is not currently experiencing significant pain during daily activities.
generated_json.instruction:
Provide a detailed summary of the patient's current illness based on their report. Include a thorough description of symptoms, noting their onset, duration, and severity or intensity. Discuss any changes or developments in symptoms since their onset and identify factors that may exacerbate or relate to these symptoms, such as specific activities, foods, or medications. Document any prior treatments or remedies the patient has attempted, noting their efficacy. Describe how these symptoms impact the patient's daily activities, overall well-being, and quality of life. Capture information about any individuals mentioned by the patient, specifying their relationship and any pertinent interactions or conversations related to the illness.

Please recheck the sentence and correct any grammatical errors in the following medical-related template. Ensure clarity, professionalism, and proper medical terminology while maintaining a concise and structured format 

End the sentence with period. Avoid direct speech and avoid talking in first person.

generated_json.title: Past Medical History
generated_json.instruction: Should include a comprehensive overview of the patient's previous medical conditions, surgeries, and significant health events.Any chronic or significant medical conditions the patient has been diagnosed with in the past, such as diabetes, hypertension, asthma, heart disease, etc.Any previous surgeries the patient has undergone in the past, including the type of surgery, date, and outcomes. Any previous hospital admissions, not related to the present illness, including the reason for admission, dates, and outcomes. Do not include current visits doctors assessment and plan in this section. This can include the assessments and plans of the previous doctors visits.

generated_json.title: Current Medications
generated_json.instruction: Document the patient's current medications in the following format: Begin with the full generic name of each medication, followed by the brand name in parentheses if applicable (e.g., "Aspirin (Bayer)"). Specify the dosage strength (e.g., "81 mg") and indicate the frequency of administration (e.g., "Once daily"). Describe the route of administration, such as oral, topical, or by injection (e.g., "Oral Aspirin"). Lastly, for ongoing medications, note the duration for which the patient has been taking each medication (e.g., "on Aspirin for 3 weeks"). If no current medications are reported, document "No current medications found."

generated_json.title: Family History

Specify the relation of the family members to the patient and include the age at diagnosis or occurrence of any significant health issues if mentioned. If no relevant family history is provided, default to "No family history found.

generated_json.title: Lab Results
content: Right index finger X-ray performed; demonstrates remodeling of the proximal phalanx consistent with good fracture healing; no signs of displacement or instability; growth plate involvement noted but stable.
generated_json.instruction: Document the patient's past lab results based on tests previously conducted, as discussed in the conversation. sub-section.title: Assessment
content: S62.209A - Unspecified fracture of proximal phalanx of right index finger, initial encounter
sub-section.instruction: Generate a list of the patient's current medical conditions, Only give all the current assessment and not historical information return it in a list. The result must be easily searchable in icd description so search for the icd code.

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Transition from cast to buddy straps for protection of the right index finger fracture.
Recommend use of buddy straps for 2 weeks to support healing.
Advise avoidance of ball sports, contact sports, and high-impact activities (e.g., tetherball, basketball, roller skating) for the next 2 weeks due to risk of re-fracture.
Educate patient and father on signs of re-injury and the importance of monitoring for pain or swelling.
Schedule follow-up in 4 to 6 weeks for repeat X-ray to assess healing progress and confirm resolution of the injury window.
Reassure that current healing is stable and no need for cast reapplication.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section, provide everything in a list.
